verse: Slaves. All those who are under the yoke of slavery must regard their masters as worthy of complete respect, so that the name of God and our teaching may not be brought into disrepute.

Those whose masters are believers must not despise them because they are brethren. On the contrary, they should serve them more, since those who receive the benefits of their services are believers and beloved brethren.
Godliness produces great gain, but only to those who are content.
For we brought nothing into this world, and we can take nothing out.
If we have food and clothing, let us be content with these.
However, those who want riches fall into temptations and are trapped into many senseless and harmful desires that plunge them into ruin and destruction.
The love of money is the root of all evils, and in their desire for it some have wandered away from the faith and pierced themselves with many serious wounds.
Fight the Good Fight. But as for you, man of God, you must shun all this. Rather, pursue righteousness, godliness, faith, love, fortitude, and gentleness.
Fight the good fight of faith. Take hold of the eternal life to which you were called when you made your noble confession of faith in the presence of many witnesses.
In the sight of God, who gave life to all things, and before Jesus Christ, who himself made that noble confession of faith in his testimony before Pontius Pilate, I charge you
to obey the commands of God without fault or failure until the appearance of our Lord Jesus Christ,
which he will make manifest at the proper time—he who is the blessed and only ruler of all, the King of kings and the Lord of lords.
He alone is immortal and dwells in unapproachable light. No one has seen him or is able to do so. To him be honor and everlasting power. Amen.

Right Use of Riches. Instruct those who are rich in this world’s goods that they should not be proud, nor should they trust in the uncertainty of riches but rather in God who richly provides us with everything we need for our enjoyment.
Tell them to do good and to be rich in good works, to be generous in giving and ready to share.
In this way, they will acquire the treasure of a good foundation for the future so that they will be able to grasp the life that is true life.
Admonition to Timothy. My brother Timothy, guard carefully what has been entrusted to you. Avoid the profane chatter and the contradictions of what is wrongly considered to be knowledge.
By professing it some people have strayed far from the faith.
